context.p: You can use a third party MathML Editor like for example the free Libre Office equation editor:

step.cmd: Install the third party application, for example Libre Office.

Open the MathML preferences page and in the External application Command line field set the command line used to open the external application. For example on Windows for starting the Libre Office equation editor the command line would need to look like this:"C:\Program Files\LibreOffice 5\program\smath.exe" "${cf}". You can use in the command line the ${cf} editor variable to refer to a temporary file automatically created by which will contain the edited MathML content.

Insert a new equation or double click an existing equation. The external application will be started and it should display the equation inside it. Once you save the equation and close the external application, the equation rendered in the Author visual editing mode will refresh its contents based on your changes.
